page.title: 12Landscape
page.content:
The Saughall area is flat; underneath is sandstone covered with clay. It is a very green and leafy place, with grass fields which are basically rectangular.Most have hedges and shallow ditches for boundaries and many have ponds. You see mature deciduous trees, telegraph poles and pylons.
There are two main roads in our block but most are narrow, quiet lanes. Saughall village is a residential place, Mollington and Backford are much smaller villages. Public Footpaths allow you to cross fields.
The canal runs through a valley, crossed on a viaduct by the Birkenhead to Chester railway.
